question: My husband is 27 years old.  We have  4 1/2 and 2 1/2 year old daughters.  My husband recently weighed as much as 140 lbs.  He was diagnosed with gastroparesis almost 3 years ago.  He was then diagnosed with diabetes one year later.  He has been taking reglan, and erythromicin, and nothing is working.  His episodes are growing closer and closer together and over the last 30 days, he has lost 15 pounds.  My husband now weighs 125 and lost the most recent 5 pounds over a 7 day period.  He does not have any weight to lose.  His General Phys. & his current GI want to refer him to a specialist in motility disorders.  Unfortunately the one they really want to send him to was working in Galveston when Ike hit last week and now we have no idea how to find him.   I am concerned and find that this is really reaching critical urgency because if he continues to lose 5 lbs/week then he will undoubtedly be to weak to walk within a 4-6 week period.  I am not ready to be a widow, nor am I ready to have my daughters left without their father.  If anyone knows of a great specialist for these circumstances please reply to this post.  I am desperate.  The doc's he has now honestly believe that his diabetes is a side effect of his gastroparesis, not the other way around which is the usual.  We are going to start a donation bank account and start having fundraisers to make the money to get him the treatment he needs even if the provider is out of network, or out of state for that matter.  My children need their father, and so do I.
title: Anyone have a clue about a good specialist for Gastroparesis?
